page.title: 12SUDELEY CASTLE - HISTORY Pt2
page.content: The castle again rose into prominence in the 15th and 16th Century. After her secret marriage to Thomas Seymour, Katherine Parr,(Henry VII's widow) came to Sudeley with large household. Five days after giving birth to Seymour's daughter, she died, and was buried in the Chapel at Sudeley. Soon afterwards, the castle passed into the hands of the Brydges family,Thomas being created Lord Chandos of Sudeley. Following the death of Elizabeth I and the Civil War, Sudeley Castle was predominantly Royalist, though held as a Parliamentary garrison for a time. Much of the Castle was demolished when the Parliamentarians were victorious. From the time of the Civil Wars, until 1837 when bought by the Dent Family, Sudeley remained forgotten. The Dent Family instigated cosiderable restoration work. (7)
